course_title: Special Topics: Human Health: Bioethics & Clinical Questions
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 30 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: Clinical Bioethics will explore basic principles of bioethics (autonomy, beneficence, nonmaleficence, and justice), while overlaying these principles into real-life settings and cases. We will explore how life and death decisions for patients are made across emergencies, every-day hospital settings, and unique scenarios to save lives.
course_description: Seminar of lecture series of topics in human health. May be repeated for credit when topic varies. Credit varies from one to four hours.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 5681, Section #: 8, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 11:30a-12:45p, Instructor: C. Gavegnano, Status: Wait List
